description: Dive into "Discover Pattaya's Hidden Free Gems" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Discover Pattaya's Hidden Free Gems

places.generalDescription: Jomtien Beach, also known as Chom Thian, is a serene 6-km stretch of sand lined with trees and offering various amenities such as loungers, bars, restaurants, and water sports. The beach provides uninterrupted views of Pattaya Bay and the surrounding area. Visitors can explore the hilltop viewpoint which offers panoramic views of Pattaya and Jomtien at any time of the day.

sources.snippet: Jomtien Beach is a stunning beach in Pattaya that offers visitors a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere without any cost. With its pristine white sand, crystal-clear waters, and palm trees lining the shore, Jomtien Beach is the perfect spot for sunbathing, swimming, or simply enjoying a leisurely stroll along the coastline. The beach also offers various water activities such as jet skiing and windsurfing for those looking for some adventure.
sources.shortName: Top Free Things to Do in Pattaya | by Vtsix Condos At View Talay 6 Pattaya

sources.snippet: When relaxation and rejuvenation are on the mind, Pattaya Jomtien Beach is the best place to be as it is counted among the peaceful beaches in Pattaya. The sun-kissed beach fringed by palm trees is an ideal place to chill out with family and friends. Moreover, the beachfront lane is lined with bustling shops, cafes, and restaurants offering sumptuous Thai seafood.
sources.shortName: 20 Places To Visit In Pattaya For Free in 2024

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs so awesome: The crowds at the popular beaches in Pattaya can get overwhelming. If you want to enjoy the sun, sand and surf but don‚Äôt want to fight for towel space, then this is the beach for you. Jomtien is a resort town for more relaxed travelers and offers a palm tree-lined beach that‚Äôs quiet, relaxing, and just as good as the more popular beaches.
sources.shortName: 31 BEST Places to Visit in Pattaya (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: If Pattaya Beach is a bit too busy or overcrowded with sunburned tourists for your liking, take a jaunt to Jomtien Beach, south of Pattaya Beach and a lot less busy. This is where many expats choose to live. Stretching over 3km with tree lined shores and blissful beachside bars, many travellers prefer Jomtien Beach to Pattaya Beach.
sources.shortName: 40 Things to do in Pattaya, Thailand

sources.snippet: Jomtien Beach has a beautiful 6 km coastline of sand and pristine water flanked by pine groves. A much more tranquil shore as compared to its neighbor in the north, the beach serves as a perfect place to laze around. It is also popular for watersports like Banana Boat, Jet Ski, kite surfing, parasailing, and windsurfing.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Things to Do in Pattaya Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: Jomtien Beach is a 6 km long stretch of sand located to the south of Pattaya Beach. This beach is much more relaxed than the central beach of the city. Jomtien Beach should be your choice if you like lazing on the beach but want to have a variety of attractions, such as restaurants and shopping malls, nearby.
sources.shortName: Pattaya, Thailand ‚Äì Detailed Guide with Travel Tips

sources.snippet: Get away from the hustle and bustle to enjoy the city‚Äôs highlights while relaxing at Jomtien Beach. Tourists can soak in the sun near the beautiful beach‚Äôs tranquil and serene beachfront. The alley along the beach is lined with popular restaurants and shacks serving delectable Thai food.
sources.siteName: Find Top Trending Blogs, Business Blog, Travel Blog | TBO Academy
sources.shortName: 9 Places To Visit In Pattaya For A Lifetime Experience!

sources.snippet: One can escape from the hustle and bustle of the main city and relax at the Jomtien Beach. Unleash the water lovers in you and make the most of the ocean with water sports options like windsurfing, parasailing, and jet skiing. When in need of refreshments, rely on the local restaurants.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Pattaya (2025)

sources.snippet: Visit this beach for its beauty during daytime and go during late nights for its exclusive night market. A more settled and lovely approach to go through the night in the city. This market has a wide scope of choices, trinket stores and street stalls all along the ocean.
sources.shortName: Free and cheap things to do in Pattaya

places.name: Jomtien Beach

reviews.text: This beach is a nice spot to relax and enjoy a quiet moment by the water. The sand is clean, the sea is calm, and it's perfect for a walk or simply sitting down to admire the view. The sunsets are particularly lovely, with a soft light that's perfect for ending the day üòé‚òÄÔ∏èüôÇüôèüåá

Visited on the weekend and it wasn't crowded at all-not surprising though, as the water isn't very clean. It's okay for a stroll or to relax by the shore, but not ideal for swimming. Also, be careful if you're a tourist-many shopkeepers charge quite high prices, so it's best to compare or ask locals first. Still, it's a more peaceful alternative to Pattaya Beach.

Jomtien Beach is a nice, long beach with a huge promenade that's perfect for a walk. It has a relaxed atmosphere with plenty of sun umbrella areas and food stalls, making it a great place to spend the day. I found it to be especially enjoyable during the day.
‚ÄãJust be aware that some sections are currently under construction, so you might need to watch out for that. Also, people tend to do a lot of activities early in the morning, which adds a lively touch to the atmosphere.

places.generalDescription: Phra Tamnak Mountain Viewpoint, also known as Wat Phra Yai, is a temple situated on the lush Khao Phra Bat hill offering stunning views of Pattaya City and its shores. The iconic Golden Buddha statue sits atop the mountain, providing panoramic vistas of the bustling city and bay below. Visitors can enjoy the elaborate staircase leading to the temple and take in the breathtaking scenery from this elevated vantage point.

sources.snippet: Pattaya can be party central and sometimes quite busy along the beach, so if you want to take a peaceful stroll, we‚Äôd recommend a coastal walk from the main ferry terminal (Bali Hai Pier) to the lighthouse at Cape Bali High /AKA Khao Phra Tamnak Viewpoint. This is a flat walk with nice views out to the ocean (and of the big Pattaya City sign) plus there are a few bars along this stretch of Pattaya ‚Äì it is also a popular spot with local fishermen. Just to note there are quite a few stray dogs along this road (often with puppies) but they seemed fine if you don‚Äôt get too close.
sources.shortName: 40 Things to do in Pattaya, Thailand

sources.snippet: Sitting at the top of a forested hill between South Pattaya and Jomtien is a giant Buddha statue known as Wat Phra Yai, The statue has its origins at a time when Pattaya was just a small fishing village, and a long way away from the world Pattaya finds itself in now. From the top of the hill you have panoramic views over Pattaya City and Bay.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Pattaya (Thailand)

places.name: Phra Tamnak Mountain Viewpoint

reviews.text: Just an amazing place to visit when you are in Pattaya. Absolutely delightful. No entrance fees and you can contribute many ways to help the area. I will buy and spend money on Free Entrance places so that they can keep the place Free. Very good view. Binoculars are only 10 bahts. You can offer incense sticks and flowers there. Lovely Chickens who like to stay up above on the mountain.
Very nice view! Today was also good weather and we gazed afar. Buy a rose or some gifts for the Budda, take a photo with the King and order pancakes creps at the vendors. All are very nice.

Get up early and travel to the top of the mountain for a great view of Pattaya, both sea and city.
Pray for good fortune and prosperity.
Hopefully I'll get to win big prizes in the lottery regularly!!!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

places.address: ‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡∏≤, Phra Tamnak, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Pattaya Beach is a bustling and popular destination with a 4 km crescent-shaped coast divided into three zones: north, center, and south. Visitors can enjoy lounging on beach chairs, engaging in water sports like parasailing, or exploring the nearby restaurants and shops.

sources.snippet: A visit to this tropical destination is not complete without visiting the famous Pattaya Beach, which is perfect for those who want to relax by the shores or engage in watersports. This beach provides a number of adventurous activities to its tourists, like jet skiing, parasailing, going on banana boat rides and even diving. For the purpose of relaxation, the soft golden sand shores appeal to the tourists to soak under the warm sun, enjoy wholesome picnics, indulge in the beachside restaurants and cafes for an elevated dining experience with gorgeous views or even shop for souvenirs at the shops.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Pattaya - Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: A sandy shore stretching along 3km of top Thailand coastline, Pattaya Beach is where everyone hangs out during the daytime, from sunbathing on the beach to wet and wild watersports. Popular with international tourists, Pattaya Beach isn‚Äôt exactly peaceful (it is surrounded by hotels, restaurants and bars) but it is a great place for swimming (certain sections have lifeguards and swimming nets). We preferred to spend time on Pattaya Beach in the early evening to watch the sunset set over the ocean.
sources.shortName: 40 Things to do in Pattaya, Thailand

sources.snippet: Pattaya Beach, which is considered to be one of the best places to visit in Pattaya for free, is divided into three zones: north, centre, and south. With its 4 km long crescent-shaped coast, Thailand's Pattaya Beach offers a wide range of water activities, along with numerous restaurants and shops along the bustling coastal road. On Pattaya Beach, visitors can sunbathe, take a thrilling banana boat ride, or unwind with a drink at a floating beachfront caf√©.
sources.shortName: 20 Places To Visit In Pattaya For Free in 2024

sources.snippet: Pattaya Beach is one of the most popular free attractions in Pattaya. This beautiful stretch of sand offers visitors a chance to relax, sunbathe, and swim without spending any money. With its crystal-clear waters and soft white sand, it‚Äôs no wonder that Pattaya Beach attracts both locals and tourists alike.
sources.shortName: Top Free Things to Do in Pattaya | by Vtsix Condos At View Talay 6 Pattaya

sources.snippet: It boasts golden sand, crystal-clear water, and a lively atmosphere. Tourists enjoy sunbathing, swimming, or engaging in various water activities. If you're traveling from Dubai, this is your chance to unwind and relax at this famous beach area.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must Visit Attractions in Pattaya

places.name: Pattaya Beach

reviews.text: I Recommend This place is perfect if you're into fun and entertainment. Lots of lights, music, and big crowds it's always lively with plenty of things to do. There are quite a lot of foreign tourists too since it's one of Thailand's must-visit landmarks.

The beach was okay for a casual visit. It was a bit crowded, but there were places to sit and relax. The water was decent, though not very clear. A few food stalls and shops nearby made it convenient. Nothing too special, but fine for spending a few hours.

A lovely spot with sandy shores and inviting waters, Pattaya Beach shines in June when it's pleasantly uncrowded and peaceful. it could be a bit cleaner during this off-peak time, and the vibrant city lights at night create a beautiful, relaxing view along the coast. Ideal for unwinding evening strolls by the sea with a soothing breeze and calm ambiance.

places.generalDescription: Bang Saray Beach, located in Pattaya, is a hidden gem with pristine white sand and a tranquil atmosphere. It's an ideal destination for those seeking solitude and relaxation as it's less crowded compared to other beaches in the area. While not as developed, the picturesque views make it perfect for unwinding and capturing stunning moments. The beach offers palm-shaded areas where visitors can bask in the soothing sound of waves and enjoy the warmth of the sun.

sources.snippet: Although the obvious free things to do when visiting Pattaya would be to hit the beach, if you have your transport, we would recommend that you take a 20-minute drive out to Bangsaray Beach for a spot of relaxation and sunbathing. Make sure you bring your own towel or beach matt along. Bangsaray Beach is simply stunning, and the views out across the Gulf of Thailand with Pattaya visible in the distance make this one of the best free places to visit in the Pattaya region.
sources.siteName: Thailand Event Guide: Top Festivals, Concerts & Cultural Experiences
sources.shortName: Free Things to Do in Pattaya

places.name: Bang Saray Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach at sunset. Super long beach and plenty of space. Some street food sellers. Some parking on the road that runs along the beach. Popular with families and couples that come to chill on the beach in the evenings.
Quite a long but narrow beach, for swimming the east end of the beach is better and very quiet. Many nice seafood restaurants along the front.

Lovely beach, clean and not crowded at all. Maybe we were lucky because it's not peak tourist season. There is also a safe swim area. The street along the beach has quite a lot of restaurants and bars where you can enjoy both Thai and Western cuisine.

places.address: Amphoe Sattahip, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Pattaya City Sign is a prominent landmark situated on a hillside, featuring the city's name in large letters and offering a platform with stunning views of the beach. This vibrant seaside resort in Thailand boasts numerous attractions, including Mini Siam theme park and bustling nightlife spots. Visitors can explore Pattaya Night Bazaar for shopping or indulge in diverse dining options.

sources.snippet: At Pattaya City Sign Viewpoint, visitors can take in breathtaking panoramic views of the city and capture stunning photos with the iconic ‚ÄúPattaya‚Äù sign in the background. This popular viewpoint offers a unique vantage point to admire the vibrant cityscape and sparkling coastline of Pattaya. Best of all, entry to this viewpoint is completely free, making it a must-visit attraction for those looking to experience the beauty of Pattaya without spending any money.
sources.shortName: Top Free Things to Do in Pattaya | by Vtsix Condos At View Talay 6 Pattaya

sources.snippet: A little of Hollywood comes to Pattaya ‚Äì the colossal Pattaya City sign is one of the city‚Äôs most popular coastal lookouts and stands proud over the bay, a short walk from Bali Hai Pier and the ferry terminal. You can get up close to the Pattaya City sign with a series of walkways around the back that start from the harbour car park in front (follow the ‚ÄòPark‚Äô signs). This is also a rather fun (and free) thing to do in Pattaya.
sources.shortName: 40 Things to do in Pattaya, Thailand

sources.snippet: Pattaya City Sign Viewpoint can be considered as one of the best places to capture the surreal views of the coast as well as the cityscape. This place is known to offer stunning views of the Pattaya Bay and Royal Thai Navy Broadcasting Station. During your visit to this place, you should make sure that you look around for a number of nautical references and lush green gardens.
sources.shortName: 20 Places To Visit In Pattaya For Free in 2024

sources.snippet: Get to experience the most beautiful and serene view from here. I wouldn't prescribe it on an insane hot day, however it will be amazing to stay here and remain till the night. The view from the sign is astounding!
sources.shortName: Free and cheap things to do in Pattaya

sources.snippet: With an endless view of the pure blue ocean, the Pattaya City Sign looks out over the Bali Hai Pier and beyond.
sources.shortName: 10 Things to See in Pattaya for Free

places.name: Pattaya City Sign

reviews.text: You can see the city sign from every point of the beach road so I was curious to see how it look like on the location. We arrived by car and there was no problem to find parking. The sign is so tall from near and hard to fit it in the photo.  The view of Pattaya bay and the marina is magnificent. There is a cute coffee shop a few steps above.

Nice viewpoint with a good view over Pattaya Bay and the city. It's a decent spot for photos, especially around sunset, and the big ‚ÄúPATTAYA CITY‚Äù sign makes for a fun backdrop.

That said, there's nothing too special or unique here. It's one of those places you visit once, take a few pics, and move on. Worth seeing if you're nearby, but not something to go out of your way for.

Still, it's free, easy to access, and a chill place to watch the city from above for a bit.

The Pattaya City sign provides exceptional panoramic views.  However, improvements are required to address the steep stair descent and the intense solar heat reflection from the concrete base.  We recommend exploring options such as altering the ground's surface color or implementing a cooling solution to mitigate the high temperatures.  Aside from these minor modifications, the vista is truly spectacular.
